poem:
Title: The Iron Veil

Towers blink as Putin reigns, his sceptre an iron scribble,
Landslide echoes, voters' sighs lost in Siberian dribble.
Ukrainian frostbite, pulsating pain, 
An election draped in dictatorial disdain.
Another sheet of ice on the curtain,
In the numbing chill, sovereignty uncertain. 
A Kremlin puppet show with a single string,
To the hollow hymn of a despot, we sing.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Kremlin signals Vladimir Putin will claim landslide Russian election victory The Kremlin has signalled that Vladimir Putin will claim a landslide victory in Russia’s presidential vote, as thousands in the country and around the world protested against his deepening dictatorship, the war in Ukraine and a stage-managed election that could have only one winner. Putin won 87% of the vote, according to exit polling published by the state-run pollsters Russian Public Opinion Research Center and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
